intro: Rhinanthus monticola, commonly known as the mountain touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in racemes, with a distinctive bilabiate structure. Rhinanthus monticola is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
